answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Hi Richard,
Milwaukee Alderman Tony Zielinski passed an ordinance recently requiring the government of a city he represents to buy American-made cars:
http://bayviewcompass.com/archives/2228
The alderman's contact information is below, they may be able to get you a copy of the ordinance in question:
Office Phone: (414) 286-3769
Fax: (414) 286-3456
TDD: (414) 286-2025 
Home Phone:  (414) 744-1802
Former Chicago Alderman William J P Banks also sponsored legislation mandating the city of Chicago buy American products. I am uncertain if that ordinance passed or not, with a little digging it may be possible to get your hands on a copy of the legislation. Here's the contact information for the Chicago City Clerk office, the best place to start:
121 N. LaSalle
  Room 107
  Chicago, IL 60602
  312-74-CLERK
I'll keep my eyes open for more examples. Hopefully this is enough to get you started. Good luck!

author: Richard White
text: Has anyone made the federal Buy American requirement ("all of the iron, steel, and manufactured goods" used in the project must have been produced in the U.S.) a local purchasing requirement?  If so, may I have a copy of the ordinance, policy, or directive?
title: Buy American - Local Version
